title: Upgrade Network Directory to McKinsey Our People page style

requirements.summary: Update Network Directory layout to card-based profile design with responsive grid matching McKinsey's Our People page
acceptanceCriteria: Profile cards are arranged in a responsive grid matching McKinsey's layout
Cards display stakeholder photos/avatars prominently
Each card shows name, role/title, and location information
Grid adapts to different screen sizes appropriately

file_operations.description: Replace the current list-based layout with a responsive grid of profile cards. Implement a card-based design where each stakeholder (hospital, healthcare professional, vendor, NGO) is displayed in a card with prominent avatar/logo placement at the top, followed by name as a heading, role/category as subheading, and location information. Use CSS Grid with responsive breakpoints (1 column mobile, 2-3 columns tablet, 3-4 columns desktop) to match McKinsey's adaptive layout pattern.

requirements.summary: Update card styling to match McKinsey's professional visual design with borders, shadows, hover effects, and typography hierarchy
acceptanceCriteria: Card design matches McKinsey's visual style with appropriate borders and shadows
Hover effects provide visual feedback matching the reference
Typography hierarchy clearly distinguishes name, role, and other details
Image/avatar treatment matches McKinsey's professional presentation

file_operations.description: Apply McKinsey-inspired card styling: subtle borders (1px solid border-color), soft shadows (shadow-sm default, shadow-md on hover), smooth hover transitions with subtle lift effect (transform: translateY(-4px)), and card background with rounded corners (rounded-lg). Implement typography hierarchy with large bold font for names (text-xl font-semibold), medium weight for roles (text-base font-medium text-muted-foreground), and smaller text for location details (text-sm text-muted-foreground). Ensure avatar/image uses rounded treatment (rounded-full for people, rounded-lg for organizations) with consistent sizing.

Add custom CSS utilities for McKinsey-style card hover effects if needed, ensuring smooth transitions and professional shadow elevations. Verify existing OKLCH color system variables work well with the new card design and adjust if necessary to maintain visual consistency with the McKinsey reference.

requirements.summary: Implement enhanced filtering system matching McKinsey's Our People page with category, location, specialty filters and clear filter controls
acceptanceCriteria: Filter controls are prominently displayed and easy to use
Multiple filters can be applied simultaneously
Active filters are clearly indicated
Filter UI matches McKinsey's design patterns

file_operations.description: Enhance the existing filter section to match McKinsey's filter UI pattern. Replace or upgrade current filtering with a prominent filter bar containing: stakeholder category dropdown (Hospital, Healthcare Professional, Vendor, NGO), location/city multi-select or dropdown, and specialty/service area filter where applicable. Implement multi-filter logic allowing users to combine filters (e.g., show only Vendors in Mumbai offering specific products). Add clear visual indicators for active filters (pill badges showing selected filters with remove icons) and a 'Clear all filters' button. Position filters above the grid in a sticky or fixed header section for easy access while scrolling.

requirements.summary: Add professional profile detail views with comprehensive stakeholder information matching McKinsey's interaction pattern
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking a profile card reveals detailed information
Detail view shows comprehensive stakeholder profile
Navigation between list and detail views is intuitive
Layout matches McKinsey's profile detail presentation

file_operations.description: Create a new detail view component for displaying comprehensive stakeholder profiles. Include sections for: header with large avatar/logo and name, role/category badge, contact information (email, phone, website with action buttons), detailed description/bio, services offered or specialties (as a list or grid), experience/credentials, location map or address details, and verification status badge. Design the layout with generous spacing matching McKinsey's professional presentation style. Support all stakeholder types (Hospital, HealthcareProfessional, Vendor, NGO) with conditional rendering based on available data fields from the backend interface.

Integrate StakeholderDetailView component with card click interactions. Implement navigation pattern: clicking a card either opens a modal overlay with the detail view or navigates to a detail route (decide based on UX preference matching McKinsey's pattern - likely modal for quick browsing). Add close/back functionality to return to the grid view. Ensure smooth transitions and maintain filter state when navigating between list and detail views. Pass the selected stakeholder data to StakeholderDetailView component.

requirements.summary: Update Network Directory spacing, padding, and layout structure to match McKinsey's generous whitespace and professional organization
acceptanceCriteria: Page layout uses generous whitespace matching McKinsey's style
Section spacing creates clear visual separation
Content margins and padding match the reference design
Overall page structure feels professional and uncluttered

file_operations.description: Update page-level spacing and layout structure to match McKinsey's generous whitespace approach. Implement: larger top padding for the page container (py-12 or py-16), wider horizontal margins for content (max-w-7xl mx-auto px-6 lg:px-8), increased gap between filter section and grid (space-y-8 or space-y-12), larger grid gaps between cards (gap-6 lg:gap-8), and generous internal card padding (p-6). Add clear section separators if needed. Ensure the overall layout feels breathable and uncluttered by avoiding cramped spacing and maintaining consistent rhythm throughout the page.

Add utility classes or adjust existing spacing scale if needed to support McKinsey-style generous whitespace. Ensure container max-widths and padding values align with the professional, spacious feel of the reference design.
